result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Death), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages.   Absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with Erin L. Sabel.
Defendant shall have no, non-adult, unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18 unless or until programming is completed and Agent approves.
Defendant shall not terminate any mental health treatment or counseling without consent of provider or Agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall remain in sex offender registry compliance.
